item.title: Diane add a quote by Annie Lamott
item.description: "No" is a complete sentence." -- Annie Lamott

item.title: Diane add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Diane add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Diane add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Diane add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Diane add a quote by Czeslaw Milosz
item.description: "I have defined poetry as a 'passionate pursuit of the Real." -- Czeslaw Milosz

item.title: Diane add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Diane add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Diane add a quote by Ishmael Reed
item.description: "No one says a novel has to be one thing. It can be anything it wants to be, a vaudeville show, the six oâ€™clock news, the mumblings of wild men saddled by demons." -- Ishmael Reed

item.title: Diane add a quote by Andrew Greeley
item.description: "We are born with two incurable diseases, life, from which we die, and hope, which says maybe death isn't the end." -- Andrew Greeley

item.title: Diane add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I have sometimes dreamt ... that when the Day of Judgment dawns and the great conquerors and lawyers and statesmen come to receive their rewards -- their crowns, their laurels, their names carved indelibly upon imperishable marble -- the Almighty will turn to Peter and will say, not without a certain envy when He sees us coming with our books under our arms, "Look, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them here. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Diane add a quote by Eugene H. Peterson
item.description: "Worship is an act that develops feelings for God, not a feeling for God that is expressed in an act of worship." -- Eugene H. Peterson
